content: everyone needs a bear headband really by kala hotakainen i woke up yesterday and decided i wanted a brown headband with bear ears on it that s a normal thought to have first thing in the morning right anyway the ears are based on what i learned from making the ears for a stuffed pooh so here s the pattern i came up with in case anyone else has a bear headband need bear headband supplies -acrylic worsted weight yarn i think i used some of that caron wintuk stuff -g hook -yarn needle -tape measure -stitch markers instructions note the ears are worked in spirals that is you will be working in the round without joing row ears make 2 -chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook -2 single_crochet in each single_crochet - increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat for round - increase in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 8sc x 2 -work even for 2 rounds -slip_stitch in next 3 stitches single_crochet in next 14 stitches slip_stitch in next 3 stitches -repeat last round -slip_stitch in next 3 slip stitches single_crochet decrease single_crochet in next 10 stitches slip_stitch in the next 3 slip stitches finish off band -chain 12 or you could chain more or less for a thicker or thinner band -work double_crochet row until piece is long enough to fit around your head comfortably seam ends together -sew ears to band and you re done
